member.name: DirectX.D3D10CompileShader

summary.div: Note Use D3DX10CompileFromMemory instead of this function.

member.param: Pointer to a string containing the shader source code.
Size of pSrcData, in bytes.
The name of the file that contains the shader code.

Optional. Pointer to an array of macro definitions (see ). The last structure in the array serves as a terminator and must have all members set to 0.
If not used, set pDefines to NULL.
Optional. Pointer to an ID3D10Include Interface interface for handling include files. Setting this to NULL will cause a compile error if a shader contains a #include.
Name of the shader-entry point function where shader execution begins.
A string that specifies the shader profile or shader model.
Shader compile options.
A pointer to an that contains the compiled shader, as well as any embedded debug and symbol-table information.
A pointer to an that contains a listing of errors and warnings that occurred during compilation. These errors and warnings are identical to the debug output from a debugger.
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10DisassembleShader
member.summary: This function -- which disassembles a compiled shader into a text string that contains assembly instructions and register assignments -- has been deprecated. Instead, use D3DDisassemble.
member.param: A pointer to the compiled shader.
The size of pShader.
Include HTML tags in the output to color code the result.
The comment string at the top of the shader that identifies the shader constants and variables.
Address of a buffer which contains the disassembled shader.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetGeometryShaderProfile
member.summary: Get the geometry shader profile best suited to a given device.
member.param: Pointer to the device (see ).

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetInputAndOutputSignatureBlob
member.summary: Get a buffer that contains shader signatures.
member.param: A pointer to the compiled shader. To get this pointer see Getting a Pointer to a Compiled Shader.
The size of the shader bytecode in bytes.
The address of a pointer to the buffer (see ).
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetInputSignatureBlob
member.summary: Get a buffer that contains shader-input signatures.
member.param: A pointer to the compiled shader. To get this pointer see Getting a Pointer to a Compiled Shader.
The size of the shader bytecode in bytes.
The address of a pointer to the buffer (see ).
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetOutputSignatureBlob
member.summary: Get a buffer that contains shader-output signatures.
member.param: A pointer to the compiled shader. To get this pointer see Getting a Pointer to a Compiled Shader.
The size of the shader bytecode in bytes.
The address of a pointer to the buffer (see ).
member.returns: This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetPixelShaderProfile
member.summary: Get the pixel shader profile best suited to a given device.
member.param: Pointer to the device (see ).

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetShaderDebugInfo
member.summary: Get shader debug info. Debug info is generated by and is embedded in the body of the shader.
member.param: A pointer to the compiled shader. To get this pointer see Getting a Pointer to a Compiled Shader.
Length of the shader bytecode buffer.
Pointer to an used to return debug info. For information about the layout of this buffer, see .
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10GetVertexShaderProfile
member.summary: Get the vertex shader profile best suited to a given device.
member.param: Pointer to the device (see ).

member.name: DirectX.D3D10PreprocessShader
member.summary: Generate a shader-text string that contains the shader tokens that would be found in a compiled shader.
member.param: Pointer to a string containing the shader source code.
Size of pSrcData, in bytes.
The name of the file that contains the shader code.

Optional. Pointer to an array of macro definitions (see ). The last structure in the array serves as a terminator and must have all members set to 0.
If not used, set pDefines to NULL.
Optional. Pointer to an ID3D10Include Interface interface for handling include files. Setting this to NULL will cause a compile error if a shader contains a #include.
A pointer to a buffer that receives a pointer to an that contains a single string containing shader-tokens.

A pointer to a buffer that receives a pointer to an that contains a listing of errors and warnings that occurred during compilation. These errors and warnings are identical to the debug output from a debugger.
member.returns: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

member.name: DirectX.D3D10ReflectShader
member.summary: This function -- which creates a shader-reflection object for retrieving information about a compiled shader -- has been deprecated. Instead, use D3DReflect.
member.param: A pointer to the compiled shader.
Length of pShaderBytecode.
Address of a reflection interface.
